name: opnssborel
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

body.origin:
|- wss(c0, c1)
-| wcel(c0, universe)
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wss(c0, c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(c0, c1)
-| wcel(c0, universe)
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wss(c0, c1))

body.origin:
|- wcel(c0, universe)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(ctopn, cfv(crrx, c2)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(c0, c1)
-| wi(wcel(c0, universe), wss(c0, c1))
-| wceq(c0, cfv(ctopn, cfv(crrx, c2)))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ⊆ c1
⊣ (c0 ∈ 𝕌 → c0 ⊆ c1)
⊣ c0 =(TopOpen `(RR^ ` c2))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, universe), wss(c0, c1))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csalgen, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wss(c0, c1)
-| wceq(c0, cfv(ctopn, cfv(crrx, c2)))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(csalgen, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ c0 ⊆ c1
⊣ c0 =(TopOpen `(RR^ ` c2))
⊣ c1 =(SalGen ` c0)

comment: Open sets of a generalized real Euclidean space are Borel sets (notice that this theorem is even more general, because ` X ` is not required to be a set). (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 3-Jan-2021.)
